docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey is steadily sealing its frontier with Syria, long infiltrated in both directions by fighters and smugglers, with fences, minefields, ditches and a wall that will snake even through the most mountainous regions.

headline.print_headline: Walls, Drones and Mines: Turkey Tightens Border as Syria Incursion Deepens
headline.main: Walls, Drones and Mines: Turkey Tightens Border as Syria Incursion Deepens

docs.snippet: Turkey is steadily sealing its frontier with Syria, long infiltrated in both directions by fighters and smugglers, with fences, minefields, ditches and a wall that will snake even through the most mountainous regions....

docs.lead_paragraph: Ireland's government will select bookrunners and co-lead managers to assist a potential share sale of state-owned Allied Irish Banks (AIB), it said on Friday, in a further signal that it could launch an IPO by May.

headline.print_headline: Ireland to Select Bookrunners, Managers as AIB IPO Inches Closer
headline.main: Ireland to Select Bookrunners, Managers as AIB IPO Inches Closer

docs.snippet: Ireland's government will select bookrunners and co-lead managers to assist a potential share sale of state-owned Allied Irish Banks (AIB), it said on Friday, in a further signal that it could launch an IPO by May....

docs.lead_paragraph: A suspected member of an Irish Republican Army splinter group has been arraigned in a Dublin court to face extradition back to Northern Ireland, where he jumped bail while awaiting trial in connection with the IRA killing of a prison guard.

headline.print_headline: IRA Suspect on the Run Over 2012 Killing Arraigned in Dublin
headline.main: IRA Suspect on the Run Over 2012 Killing Arraigned in Dublin

docs.snippet: A suspected member of an Irish Republican Army splinter group has been arraigned in a Dublin court to face extradition back to Northern Ireland, where he jumped bail while awaiting trial in connection with the IRA killing of a prison guard....

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. high-end department store chain Neiman Marcus has hired investment bank Lazard Ltd to explore ways to bolster its balance sheet as it seeks relief from $4.9 billion in debt, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Neiman Marcus Hires Debt Restructuring Adviser-Sources
headline.main: Exclusive: Neiman Marcus Hires Debt Restructuring Adviser-Sources

docs.lead_paragraph: Retail currency brokers are considering operating in the United States after a nearly seven-year absence, if President Donald Trump is able to carry through on his pledge to deregulate financial markets.

headline.main: Forex Brokers Eye U.S. Market as Trump Vows to Deregulate

docs.lead_paragraph: Volkswagen's luxury division Audi is recalling 681,000 cars in China to fix coolant pumps that could overheat, a spokesman said.
